heading: hang up and watch
subheading: the world's no. 4 wireless phonemaker says a public movie theater is no place for a private phone call in its latest ad campaign.
author: reuters
text: fed up with people talking on portable phones in the wrong places? you'll love a mobile phonemaker's latest ad campaign, to be introduced in french cinemas on bastille day, 14 july. moviegoers will be treated to spots from france's alcatel -- the world's fourth-biggest supplier of gsm mobiles -- that show inconsiderate phone users being scalped by american indians or attacked by kung-fu experts.created by agency devarieuxvillaret, the spots portray film characters becoming so outraged at viewers using mobiles during their film that they attack."being a maker of mobile phones and promoting their development is completely in line with our desire to see them used in a more responsible way," says jacques combet, alcatel's director of mobile phones, in a statement issued monday.the campaign is due to run until 14 september at the gaumont and pathe cinema chains as well as in independent theaters, alcatel said.copyright
